com.stormpath.sdk.convert

Class Conversion

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.stormpath.sdk.convert.Conversion

  • public class Conversion
extends Object
    A Conversion represents directives that indicate how to convert one object (or collection) into another.
    Since:
    1.3.0

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Conversion()
      Default constructor that enables the following settings: enabled = true strategy = SCALARS

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      ElementsConversion getElements()
      Returns the ElementsConversion that indicates how to convert a collection's elements.
      String getField()
      Returns the name of the field on the input object to use as the only output value.

      Returns the Conversion directives for any specifically named fields encountered on an input object.
      String getName()
      Returns the field/property name to represent the converted output object.
      ConversionStrategyName getStrategy()
      Returns the conversion strategy to use when converting an input object to an output object.
      boolean isEnabled()
      Returns true if this conversion is enabled and will result in a converted value, or false if no conversion will occur and the input field or object will be skipped/removed entirely.
      Conversion setElements(ElementsConversion elements)
      Sets the ElementsConversion that indicates how to convert a collection's elements.

      Sets whether or not the conversion is enabled and will result in a converted value.

      Sets the field/property name to represent the converted output object.

      Sets the strategy to use when converting an input object to an output object.

      Sets the strategy to use when converting the input object.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Conversion

        public Conversion()
        Default constructor that enables the following settings:
        • enabled = true
        • strategy = SCALARS

    • Method Detail

      • isEnabled

        public boolean isEnabled()
        Returns true if this conversion is enabled and will result in a converted value, or false if no conversion will occur and the input field or object will be skipped/removed entirely. Unless overridden, the default value is true, meaning a discovered input field/object should be converted by default.
        Returns:
        true if this conversion is enabled and will result in a converted value, or false if no conversion will occur and the input field or object will be skipped/removed entirely.

      • setEnabled

        public Conversion setEnabled(boolean enabled)
        Sets whether or not the conversion is enabled and will result in a converted value. If false, no conversion will take place and the input object will not be represented at all. Unless overridden, the default value is true, meaning a discovered input field/object should be converted by default.
        Parameters:
        enabled - whether or not the conversion is enabled and will result in a converted value.
        Returns:
        this object for method chaining.

      • getName

        public String getName()
        Returns the field/property name to represent the converted output object. If unspecified, the name will be the same name as discovered on the input object.
        Returns:
        the field/property name to represent the converted output object.

      • setName

        public Conversion setName(String name)
        Sets the field/property name to represent the converted output object. If unspecified, the name will be the same name as discovered on the input object.
        Parameters:
        name - the field/property name to represent the converted output object.
        Returns:
        this object for method chaining.

      • getStrategy

        public ConversionStrategyName getStrategy()
        Returns the conversion strategy to use when converting an input object to an output object. Unless overridden, the default strategy is SCALARS.
        Returns:
        the conversion strategy to use whne converting the input object to an output object.

      • setStrategy

        public Conversion setStrategy(ConversionStrategyName strategy)
        Sets the strategy to use when converting an input object to an output object. Unless overridden, the default strategy is SCALARS.
        Parameters:
        strategy - the strategy to use when converting the input object.
        Returns:
        this object for method chaining.
        See Also:
        ConversionStrategyName

      • setStrategy

        public Conversion setStrategy(String strategy)
        Sets the strategy to use when converting the input object. This is a convenience method that looks up the ConversionStrategyName instance using the method argument.

        Unless overridden, the default strategy is SCALARS.

        Parameters:
        strategy - the strategy to use when converting the input object.
        Returns:
        this object for method chaining.
        See Also:
        setStrategy(ConversionStrategyName), ConversionStrategyName

      • getField

        public String getField()
        Returns the name of the field on the input object to use as the only output value. This property is only used with the SINGLE strategy - it is ignored otherwise.
        Returns:
        the name of the field on the input object to use as the only output value.
        See Also:
        ConversionStrategyName.SINGLE

      • setField

        public Conversion setField(String field)
        Sets the name of the field on the input object to use as the only output value. This property is only used with the SINGLE strategy - it is ignored otherwise.
        Parameters:
        field - the name of the field on the input object to use as the only output value.
        Returns:
        this object for method chaining.
        See Also:
        ConversionStrategyName.SINGLE

      • getFields

        public Map<String,Conversion> getFields()
        Returns the Conversion directives for any specifically named fields encountered on an input object. The Map's String key is the name of a field on the object to convert. The Map value for that key is the Conversion that indicates how to convert the corresponding field's value.

        Because Conversion instances can contain fields (Maps of named Conversion instances), and so on, a Conversion can reflect how to convert an entire object graph if desired.

        Returns:
        the Conversion directives for any specifically named fields encountered on an input object.

      • setFields

        public Conversion setFields(Map<String,Conversion> fields)
        Sets the Conversion directives for any specifically named fields encountered on an input object. The Map's String key is the name of a field on the object to convert. The Map value for that key is the Conversion that indicates how to convert the corresponding field's value.

        Because Conversion instances can contain fields (Maps of named Conversion instances), and so on, a Conversion can reflect how to convert an entire object graph if desired.

        Parameters:
        fields - the conversions to apply when encountering named field values
        Returns:
        this Conversion object for method chaining.

      • withField

        public Conversion withField(String fieldName,
                            Conversion conversion)
        A convenience builder method that will add the specified conversion argument to the fields map under the specified fieldName key.
        Parameters:
        fieldName - the name of the field on the input object to be converted
        conversion - the conversion to apply when encountering the named field on the input object
        Returns:
        this object for method chaining.

      • getElements

        public ElementsConversion getElements()
        Returns the ElementsConversion that indicates how to convert a collection's elements. This property is only used if the input object is a collection resource - it is ignored otherwise.
        Returns:
        the ElementsConversion that indicates how to convert a collection's elements.

      • setElements

        public Conversion setElements(ElementsConversion elements)
        Sets the ElementsConversion that indicates how to convert a collection's elements. This property is only used if the input object is a collection resource - it is ignored otherwise.
        Parameters:
        elements - the ElementsConversion that indicates how to convert a collection's elements.
        Returns:
        this object for method chaining.
